Hello.

I'm trying to "squeeze" a SyncML-based two-way communication (with a 
external app) in our Rest infrastructure. We are not using the full set 
of SyncML specifications, and we have not a SyncML server or any SyncML 
infrastructure, we are only using SyncML as a "normalization" tool 
between two disparate systems.

Now, it seems to me that the SyncML protocol is the opposite of Rest, as 
it is based on commands as opposed to resources. How can I make this two 
scenarios compatible? Has anyone had experience with this kind of problem?

Thanks.
